verses.text: I earnestly wish ye could bear with me a little in \add my\add* folly: and indeed bear with me.
For I am jealous over you with godly jealousy: for I have espoused you to one husband, that I may present \add you as\add* a chaste virgin to Christ.
But I fear, lest by any means, as the serpent beguiled Eve through his subtilty, so your minds should be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ.

For if he that cometh preacheth another Jesus, whom we have not preached, or \add if\add* ye receive another spirit, which ye have not received, or another gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with \add him\add* .
For I suppose I was not a whit behind the very greatest apostles.
But though \add I am\add* rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have been thoroughly made manifest among you in all things.
Have I committed an offense in abasing myself that ye might be exalted, because I have preached to you the gospel of God without reward?
I robbed other churches, taking wages \add of them\add* , to do you service.

And when I was present with you, and wanted, I was chargeable to no man: for that which was lacking to me the brethren who came from Macedonia supplied: and in all \add things\add* I have kept myself from being burdensome to you, and \add so\add* will I keep \add myself\add* .
As the truth of Christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this boasting in the regions of Achaia.
Why? because I love you not? God knoweth.
But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them who desire occasion; that in what they glory, they may be found even as we.
For such \add are\add* false apostles, deceitful workers, transforming themselves into the apostles of Christ.
And no wonder; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.
Therefore \add it is\add* no great thing if his ministers also are transformed as the ministers of righteousness; whose end shall be according to their works.
I say again, Let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a fool receive me, that I may boast myself a little.
That which I speak, I speak \add it\add* not according to the Lord, but as it were foolishly, in this confidence of boasting.
Seeing that many glory after the flesh, I will glory also.
For ye suffer fools gladly, seeing ye \add yourselves\add* are wise.
For ye suffer, if a man bringeth you into bondage, if a man devoureth \add you\add* , if a man taketh \add from you\add* , if a man exalteth himself, if a man smiteth you on the face.
I speak as concerning reproach, as though we had been weak. But in whatever respect any is bold, (I speak foolishly) I am bold also.
Are they Hebrews? so \add am\add* I. Are they Israelites? so \add am\add* I. Are they the offspring of Abraham? so \add am\add* I.
Are they ministers of Christ? (I speak as a fool) I \add am\add* more; in labors more abundant, in stripes above measure, in prisons more frequent, in deaths often.
From the Jews five times I received forty \add stripes\add* save one.
Thrice was I beaten with rods, once I was stoned, thrice I suffered shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep;

\add In\add* journeyings often, \add in\add* perils of waters, \add in\add* perils of robbers, \add in\add* perils by \add my own\add* countrymen, \add in\add* perils by the heathen, \add in\add* perils in the city, \add in\add* perils in the wilderness, \add in\add* perils in the sea, \add in\add* perils among false brethren;
In weariness and painfulness, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, in cold and nakedness.
Besides those things that are without, that which cometh upon me daily, the care of all the churches.
Who is weak, and I am not weak? who is made to fall into sin, and I burn not?
If I must needs glory, I will glory of the things which concern my infirmities.
The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who is blessed for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.
In Damascus the governor under Aretas the king kept the city of the Damascenes with a garrison, desirous to apprehend me:
And through a window in a basket I was let down by the wall, and escaped his hands.
